result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Erick Aaron Brown

Jury Trial exhibits from 09-06-2022 inventoried on this date.
Location: 792

Order for Presentence Investigation Report (PSI)
, Signed

At the hour of 11:20 am the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read.  

"We, the jury, find the defendant, MR. ERICK AARON BROWN, GUILTY of Second Degree Sexual Assault of a Child, as charged in COUNT ONE of the Information."

"We, the jury, find the defendant, MR. ERICK AARON BROWN, GUILTY of Child Enticement, as charged in COUNT TWO of the Information."

Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed. 

At the hour of 11:38 am jury dismissed for the day.

Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction.

Court ordered the defendant REMANDED into custody.  

Court ordered a presentence investigation without a recommendation. Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.

Case adjourned for sentencing hearing on November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am, branch 45.

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Erick Aaron Brown.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for jury trial. Trial continued at the hour of 8:40 am. Juror #30 not present due to medical emergency; both parties agree to juror #30 being an alternative juror. Jury back in box at the hour of 8:45 am. Court instructs jury. Court charge the jury. Jury retired at the hour of 8:50 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriffs Deputies Humayou Saleem and Leon Martin who were duly sworn for that purpose. 

Case called to address jury questions 1 and 2. Jury back in box at the hour of 10:03 am to listen to exhibit 6. Jury out of box at the hour of 10:09 am. 

*Jury question 1 at 9:35 am and answer placed on the record.
*Jury question 2 at 9:44 am and answer placed on the record. 
*Jury question 3 at 10:19 am and answer placed on the record.
*Jury question 4 at 10:43 am and answer placed on the record.

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Erick Aaron Brown.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.   Jury in the box at 9:11, continuation of trial.  Officer Keith Miller was sworn and testified.  Exhibits 7, 22,23,24 were offered and received.   Jury out of the box at 10:31 for a short break.  Jury in the box at 10:45.  Cross examination of witness.  Redirect by the state.  Re cross by defense.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of the box at 11:35 and instructed to return at 1:30 for continuation of trial.  
Defense moves to Dismiss, Statements made, the Court DENIED defense motion to Dismiss.

Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Statements made by Court and defendant, the court finds the defendant freely, knowingly and intelligently elects to testify.  
Trial to continue at 1:30 this same date.   


PM SESSION,  SAME APPEARANCES
Jury in the box at 1:48.  Sworn to testify: Defendant Erick Brown.  Cross exam by State.  Defense rests, testimony closed.  
Jury out of the box at 2:45.  Jury instructions discussed between court and counsels.  
Jury in the box at 3:23, Jury instructions given by the court.  

Closing arguments heard.

Court dismissed the jury at 4:20 with instructions to appear in Br 45 at 8:30 for continuation of trial.   mn

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Erick Aaron Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Jury in the box at

Exhibits 3, 4, 8,9,14,15, 16,17, 19, 20, 21 offered and received.  
Jury out of the box for break at 3:05.

Jury in the box at 3:29

The Court released the jurors for the day with instructions to return tomorrow for continuation of trial in Br 45.  mn

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Erick Aaron Brown.  Prosecuting attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Officer Keith Miller also appeared in court.  
Jury in the box at 9:13.
Cross examination of  Briana W., who was sworn.  re-direct and re- cross took place.

Exhibits 2,6, 11, 11a, 11b, 11c,11d,11e,  12,13, 18 were offered and received.

Side bar placed on the record.    Trial to continue at 1:30.   mn

PM SESSION

Jury Panel in Court at 1:42 pm.

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Erick Aaron Brown.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for SPEEDY Jury Trial. Parties appeared in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Discussion placed on the record. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel is ready to proceed. State is ready to proceed. Jury Selection proceeded.
Defense Motion in Limine; received and filed.

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court, in custody.  Attorney Fred Richardson III in court for Erick Aaron Brown.  Attorney Erin Michelle Karshen in court for State of Wisconsin.   Arguements  heard as to  State's motion on Other Acts Motion.  State's motion granted.  

Defense Motion to Suppress proceeded.  Court has reviewed the video's submitted.  Defense motion reviewed.  State's witness: Officer Keith Miller, MPD, Sworn to testify.  Exhibit 1 offered and received.  Cross examination of witness by defense.  Re direct by the State.  Re cross by defense.   The Court conducts colloquy with defendant regarding his right to testify.  Statements made.  The Court finds the defendant freely, knowingly and intelligently waived his rights to testify.   Testimony closed.  Arguments heard.  The Court DENIED Defense Motion.   Offer placed on the record, to be discussed between defense and defendant.  Case remains calendared in Br 45.  mn
Letter from defendant.  (Erick Brown, House of Correction, 8885 S 68th St, Franklin WI 53132).

expires 10.4.22

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court with attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in custody, CJF.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erick Aaron Brown appeared by video means.  Defense bail motion argued and denied.  Final pre-trial and motion filing deadline August 4, 2022 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court with Attorney Fred Richardson.  Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective K. Miller. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Case is adjourned to Branch 34.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BG W, O G, or N Q K.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Defendant Erick Aaron Brown in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Erick Aaron Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Judge Jean Kies, Br 45, room 502 SB  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
